Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery skyphos of Corinthian type; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; exterior: narrow black band below rim; black-figure decoration consisting of two confronted sirens (head with added red, hair and wing with red remaining of siren on the left; head with red and hair remaining of that on right).
Bibliographic references: Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 259, no. 18)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 360, no. B467)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 147) (note 43/25)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 228, no. 25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0337) (Phase 1)
